summary: This document appears to be a daily assignment log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering dates from late July to mid-August 2019. It shows inmate assignments to different housing units and special statuses like 'DRY CELL' and 'SHU' (Special Housing Unit), which is significant as it covers the period immediately before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: MCC Inmate Housing Assignments
events.description: Daily log of inmate assignments at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, showing rotations between general population units (e.g., 7 SOUTH, 11 SOUTH, 9 NORTH) and special status units including the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and Dry Cell.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York
locations.context: Federal detention facility in New York, NY where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

locations.name: SHU #1, SHU #2, SHU #4
locations.context: Special Housing Unit (solitary confinement) sections within MCC.

locations.name: DRY CELL
locations.context: A cell without plumbing fixtures to prevent disposal of contraband, often used for suicide watch or monitoring.

keyFacts: The log covers the critical period from July 22, 2019, to August 17, 2019, which includes the date of Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
Assignments include regular housing units (DNV 8, OTMNV 2), Special Housing Units (SHU), and a 'DRY CELL', indicating varying levels of supervision and confinement.
The document is a routine prison administrative record that would be scrutinized as part of investigations into Epstein's custody conditions and death.
No specific inmate names are listed in this excerpt; it appears to be a template or log for staff assignments.
The timestamp '8/12/2019 9:10:39 AM' suggests the log was generated or accessed on August 12, 2019, two days after Epstein's death.
